In October 2005, Blogger and access to the Google Cache were made available in China; however, in December 2005, some Chinese users of Blogger reported that their access to the site was once again restricted.
In October 2005, Blogger and access to the Google Cache were made available in China; however, in December 2005, some Chinese users of Blogger reported that their access to the site was once again restricted.

In January 2006 Google affirmed its intent to censor material in China that the Chinese government found objectionable. The restrictions will apply to thousands of terms and websites.[http://www.breitbart.com/news/2006/01/24/D8FBCF686.html]
+
In January 2006 Google affirmed its intent to censor material in China that the Chinese government found objectionable. The restrictions will apply to thousands of terms and websites.[http://www.breitbart.com/news/2006/01/24/D8FBCF686.html] The censored content will appear on a website called google.cn. Google was heavily criticized by the move, yet it claims itis doing the best it can to make more information accessible. The company does not plan to give the Chinese government information about the users that searches blocked content and will inform of restricted categories. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/4647398.stm]
